revision.text:
The '''SC50 bomb''' ('''[[Sprengbombe-Cylindrisch bomb (disambiguation)|Sprengbombe Cylindrisch]] 50''') was a type of drop ordnance or free fall bomb built by Germany during World War II. Used as a general purpose bomb, it had a one-piece drawn steel body and its total weight was 48 to 55 kg.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.warbirdsresourcegroup.org/LRG/sc50ja.html|title=LUFTWAFFE RESOURCE CENTER |date= 2013 |website=Warbirds Resource Group |publisher= |access-date=25 May 2015}}</ref> It was dropped in the early 1940s on London. The SC-50 was a German bomb dropped by the Luftwaffe on central London.
==2015 Wembley bomb== In May 2015 a SC50 was unearthed in a building site on Empire Way, Wembley, London. Bomb disposal experts from [[11 Explosive Ordnance Disposal]] in the [[Royal Logistics Corps]] attempted to defuse it. It was later removed and detonated safely it at a secret location.<ref>http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2015/may/22/bomb-found-200m-from-wembley-stadium-safely-detonated-by-army</ref>
==Popular culture== In the video game [[IL-2 Battle of Stalingrad]], SC50 and [[SC250 bomb|SC250]] are available as armaments. In the Dad's Army episode "Something Nasty in the Vault", an unexploded SC50 traps Captain Mainwaring and Sergeant Wilson in the bank vault. The SC50 and SC500 are also available as armament for German aircraft in the MMO game War Thunder and the flight simulator [[Digital Combat Simulator]].
